Package controller

Class PartScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.PartScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class PartScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class that controls the logic of the part screen of the application.

RUNTIME ERROR On previous version, there was error observed during modifying Part when switching type from outsource to machineid because of format difference as machineid cannot hold non-numeric which I have fixed by implementing another try catch block during checking the textfield on the checkValidity() class and the program will expect to throw NumberExceptionError like other required numeric fields. Another error was that machineid was initialized as integer hence it could not hold larger number and to fix this, it has been changed to long.

FUTURE ENHANCEMENT I would like to add more variety Part Type to select and to select from many variety, I would use combo box to display the Part Type information.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Rifatul Karim

      public PartScreenController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initiated upon calling this controller when selecting to modify/add Part from the main screen. It will disable the ability the edit data of the id field and also disable the part Type field until user pick one of Part Type. Furthermore, it will let the program know if the user is in modify or add screen and save the data accordingly.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • partSave_ClickHandler

      public void partSave_ClickHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Functions to save the new or modified Part data to the inventory. Check the data validity and prints out error if present otherwise takes user to the main screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - add Data click handler

    • cancelAction

      public void cancelAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Takes the user to the main screen. Throws IOException if it cannot locate MainScreen.fxml
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - cancel Action

    • initData

      public void initData​(Part selectedPart)
      Initiates to transfer the selected part data from the main screen part Table to the Part screen.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the part data that is selected from the main screen Part table.

    • checkDataValidity

      private boolean checkDataValidity()
      Checks all the data inputs on the textfield and see if they are in right format and follows the rule. Afterwards it will print out for each errors into the same screen otherwise returns false to indicate there are no error.
      Returns:
      returns true if there is error present.

    • inHouseButtonHandler

      public void inHouseButtonHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Radio Button that serves to indicate the part type is in-house and then will change the part type label accordingly.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - inHouse Button Handler

    • outSourcedButtonHandler

      public void outSourcedButtonHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Radio Button that serves to indicate the part type is outsourced and then will change the part type label accordingly.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - outsource button handler

    • emptyErrorLabels

      private void emptyErrorLabels()
      Removes the error messages display on the screen.
